intro: Conophytum simplum, commonly known as the "Simplified Coneplant," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically reduced to tubercles, which help minimize water loss in arid environments. Conophytum simplum is well-suited for rock gardens and dry landscapes due to its compact size and drought tolerance.
